AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: city located on Interstate Highway 35, leading directly to the Mexican border, and a point of reference for determining distance from the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical boundary relevant to the case and the Brignoni-Ponce test, with Interstate 35 being a common route leading to it
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.northbound lanes of Interstate Highway 3: specific segment of the highway with known alien smuggling activity, where vehicles are unusual to be traveling at slow speeds late at night, and where border patrol agents had recently apprehended illegal alien smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where stops by border patrol agents may occur, commonly used for smuggling of aliens, and known for its reputation as a common smuggling route, with other highways intersecting it near the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck: vehicle stopped on an Interstate Highway in Texas, containing a heavily loaded camper attachment, with occupants attempting to evade detection
